The prospect also exists for discovery of therapeutic agents targeting the highly conserved proteins associated with both SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
15− 18 RdRp and 3CLpro protease of SARS-CoV-2 share over 95% of sequence similarity with those of SARS-CoV despite the fact that these two viruses demonstrate only 79% sequence similarity at the genome level.
15− 18 On the basis of sequence alignment and homology modeling, SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 share a highly conserved receptor-binding domain (RBD), a domain of S protein, and 76% of sequence similarity in their S proteins.
15− 18 In addition, although the PLpro sequences of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV are only 83% similar, they share similar active sites.
